R. L. Stine meets some one special.....

comments.text: "Hey! How come nobody dressed up as Ann?"
comments.author: Brandon Wilhelmsen

comments.text: Ugh. Ann creeps me out.
comments.author: Ellie Anderson

top_comment.text: I think r.l.Stein is really matt.﻿
top_comment.author: Rebecca Greaves

comments.text:
No... they bribed the real Stein to appear on the show just for this one 
skit.
comments.author: odduckOasis

comments.text: K
comments.author: Win Ner

top_comment.text:
Holy Crap I hate Studio C. I was hoping this would be their saving grace 
but that was just terrible. Just because we're mormon doesn't mean we can't 
be funny dang it.﻿
top_comment.author: jonnybeauchamp

comments.text:
The reason the skits on Studio C are not geared towards LDS is to keep the 
humor more relate-able to others outside our faith. When they were part of 
'divine comedy' at BYU, that was humor that really only LDS people would 
get. Since this is actually public and seen by more than just members of 
the church, and to make it more appealing to the masses, they are keeping 
the jokes neutral so anyone can enjoy and relate. Besides, it's all just 
silly non-sense anyways and shouldn't be taken so seriously. Like you 
yourself said- just stop watching and don't worry about it. It's not going 
to impact your life if you don't watch it either way. =)
comments.author: odduckOasis

comments.text:
+jonnybeauchamp that's my favorite studio c clip "OH!!! MURDER!!! go to 
that giant oak in the sky!"
comments.author: Kiry Cole-church

comments.text:
Ok, I just watched it. And it wasn't bad, but not all that fantastic 
either. Can't really say anything more about it. Sorry but still not 
terribly impressed.
comments.author: jonnybeauchamp

comments.text:
+jonnybeauchamp watch "studio C leaves" its funny, and about a leaf. Then 
came back and say how bad you thought it was. Its 30 seconds long. Just do 
it.
comments.author: Kiry Cole-church

comments.text:
It's true I did imply that anyone that enjoys Studio C would love the skits 
that boys do perform for boy scout camp. And you have to admit that most of 
Studio C's skits are basically that. But I never said my sense of humor was 
better, just that I no longer enjoy the humor they make.
And trust me I have not watched another video from Studio C sense this one. 
And I won't do it again any time soon.
comments.author: jonnybeauchamp

comments.text:
First, no one's forcing you to watch Studio C.  Feel free to make your own 
comedy thing if you feel that Mormon comedy should be better.  Second, you 
just heavily implied that anyone who found this enjoyable has an inferior 
sense of humor incapable of moving past the skits that 12 year olds do for 
boy scout camps.  It might just be me, but that does come off as slightly 
imposing.
comments.author: Peter Zhao

comments.text: +jonnybeauchamp can't hear you over the sound of how awesome I am
comments.author: Kiry Cole-church

comments.text:
So what you're saying is because I have a different opinion then all of you 
means I'm Satan. Super good argument.

And as it goes with the apples and oranges, I do like oranges more than 
apples. How did you know? Also no matter how much you say that Studio C 
doesn't represent LDS people, it does. And I'm not saying that I wouldn't 
appreciate an apple once in a while. But when that is the ONE and ONLY kind 
of fruit you get. You would not enjoy apples in the least. But throw in 
some strawberries, bananas, oranges and there you go. A good show. 

To throw it out there as well, I didn't "impose" my thoughts on you at all. 
I just wanted to say what I was thinking. And to be honest it's kinda fun 
going back and forth like this.
comments.author: jonnybeauchamp

comments.text: Satan finally made a youtube account.
comments.author: Kiry Cole-church

comments.text:
Sir, all I'm hearing is something along the lines of this:

You like oranges.  We like apples.  But just because you like oranges 
better than apples, you decide arbitrarily that oranges are the best type 
of fruit ever, and that anyone who disagrees with you has an underdeveloped 
sense of refinement.  Not satisfied with keeping your overweening sense of 
superiority to yourself, you actively attack and insult those different 
from you, who enjoy the crisp taste of apple, whether we also like oranges 
or not.

So I guess what I'm saying is, feel free to not like it, but you don't have 
to impose your own distinct idea of humor on everyone else.  We don't need 
one master sense of humor that is better than anything else.
comments.author: Peter Zhao

comments.text:
Then you miss read, because I was not trying to be funny in the least. And 
I have no clue where you are getting that from. 

And ok cool, they represent you that like Studio C. I guess what I should 
have said is that I wish they were funny so I could like them too. But my 
sense of humor has moved pass the skits that 12 year olds do for boy scout 
camp. So enjoy all you want.
comments.author: jonnybeauchamp

comments.text:
And what I'm saying is that you were obviously trying to be witty or clever 
with the latter part of your sentence and failed, and thus invalidated your 
own point.

And no, they aren't representing "us", you inclusive.  YOU, sir, represent 
a distinctly disgruntled and small minority within this larger group that 
DO think Studio C is funny.  Studio C, then, represents us, excluding you, 
which is perfectly fine with the rest of us who do appreciate the humor.
comments.author: Peter Zhao

comments.text:
Well ok let me spell this out for you that are confused. Studio C IS NOT 
FUNNY!! I have watched many of their videos, not a single one is funny. And 
the second half of what I was saying is most people that watch this crap 
are mormon. And just because we're mormon doesn't mean we can't have funny 
videos. Make it more like SNL just make it more relatable to LDS people. 
THAT DOES NOT MEAN STUPID, it means funny. LDS people can be funny, Studio 
C is NOT. But they're the ones representing us.
comments.author: jonnybeauchamp

comments.text:
Agreed, your sentence makes no sense. And if you're judging Studio C's 
comedy based on this one video (or even this one character)- that's rather 
narrow minded of you, just sayin'.
comments.author: odduckOasis

comments.text:
Okay, I'm confused by your comment.... You're saying that Studio C sucks, 
yet "because we're Mormon doesn't mean we can't be funny" which is implying 
that you are Mormon and you think it's funny...? Can you clarify on whether 
or not you like Studio C?
comments.author: Win Ner

comments.text:
Sir, you said nothing about DESERVING good humor.  You merely said that 
just because you were mormon does not mean that you can't be funny.  I 
merely opined that you disproved your statement because it was not funny.
comments.author: Peter Zhao

comments.text:
So what you're saying is because we are mormon we don't deserve good humor? 
Well thats a crappy view on things.
comments.author: jonnybeauchamp

comments.text:
Sir, never have I thought it more appropriate to tell someone that they 
have just disproved their own point.  Congratulations.
comments.author: Peter Zhao

captions.text:
>>OH R.L. STEIN, THE R.L STEIN?
SIR, I HAVE READ ALL OF THE GOOSEBUMP SERIES.

I'M A--WE ARE HUGE FANS.
>>WELL THANK YOU.

>>YEAH, SERIOUSLY, EVERY TIME I'D READ YOUR
BOOKS,

THEY'D GIVE ME CHILLS, OR GOOSEBUMPS ON
MY ARMS.

>>YES, WELL I'M GLAD THAT I COULD FIND MY
WAY INTO

THE CREEPING SHADOWS OF YOUR CHILDHOOD.
>>OH YEAH.

LOOK OVER THERE.
OH.

JUST SO YOU KNOW, THIS GUY IS KIND OF CREEPY.
OH!
>>YOU CAN'T SCARE ME.
>>COME ON HONEY. IT'LL BE OKAY.

>>OH HELLO.
>>HELLO MR. STEIN. I'M ANN WITHERS.

>>JEN?
>>ANN.

>>GLENN?
>>ANN.

>>YEN?
>>ANN.

ANN.
>>OH ANN.

>>YES!
ANN.

SERIOUSLY?
IT'S THREE LETTERS LONG.

>>YEAH.
>>SORRY IF I'M A BIT OUT OF SORTS,

I SEEM TO BE HAVING A BAD HAIR DAY.
>>YES, THAT'S VERY INNOVATIVE.

>>MAY I TAKE A PICTURE WITH YOU?
>>OKAY.

>>OKAY, YES, HERE WE GO.
SAY CHEESE AND DIE!

OH, OH DEAR!
MY FINGER SEEMS TO BE OVER THE LENS.

ONE MORE EH?
SAY CHEESE AND DIE AGAIN!

>>OKAY, THANK YOU ANN!
>>WELL MAYBE AFTER THIS IS ALL OVER YOU'D

LIKE
TO COME OUT WITH ME.

WE COULD TAKE A WALK DOWN GHOST BEACH.
>>ACTUALLY I'M AFRAID I MUST SAY GOOD-BYE

NOW.
WE HAVE TO KEEP THIS LINE MOVING.

>>YES OF COURSE.
>>GOOD-BYE ANN.

>>ANN.
OKAY.

LET ME JUST.
THESE ARE MINE.

OKAY.
>>SWEET GIRL EH?

NOT UNLIKE YOURSELF I'M SURE.
>>OH.

>>YOU ALREADY GOT A BOOK SIGNED ANN.
>>ANN.

>>YOU HAVE TO LEAVE.
>>NO, HOW COULD YOU TELL IT WAS ME?

THIS IS A SHOCKER ON SHOCK STREET.
WHICH INCIDENTALLY IS ONE OF YOUR WEAKER TITLES.

WERE YOU EVEN TRYING ON THAT ONE?
>>I DON'T TRY ON ANY OF THEM.

>>WELL UM, I JUST CAME BACK TO TELL YOU
THAT YOU SPELLED MY NAME WRONG.

YOU JUST WROTE THE LETTER N THREE TIMES.
>>NOTHING I CAN DO ABOUT THAT NOW.

>>NO!
PLEASE, GO EAT WORMS.

>>ANN, PLEASE ENOUGH!
WATCHING YOU RUN IS EXHAUSTING ME.

>>MR. STINE, YOU POSSESS A SORT OF
MAGIC IN YOUR GAZE AND I AM UNDER THE MAGICIAN'S SPELL.
>>ARE YOU COMING ONTO ME?

NO ONE HAS EVER DONE THAT.
>>MHM, YOUR PULSE IS VERY QUICK.
EITHER YOUR HEART IS RACING OR YOUR VEINS ARE

FULL OF MONSTER BLOOD.
>>MHM...

YOU MAKE ALL MY TITLES SOUND SO MUCH BETTER.
>>I WISH I COULD COME UP WITH YOUR TITLES

FOR ALL OF TIME.
>>BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU WISH FOR.

>>MHM....
>>WOULD YOU CARE TO HAVE LUNCH WITH ME?

WE COULD HAVE CHICKEN CHICKEN.
>>SOUNDS DELICIOUS.

>>UH, MR. STINE, WHAT SHOULD I DO ABOUT THE
PEOPLE THAT ARE IN LINE STILL.

>>TELL THEM, WHY I'M AFRAID OF BEES.
>>WHY ARE YOU?

>>IT'S JUST A BOOK TITLE JEREMY.
SO ANN, HOW OLD ARE YOU?

>>I PREFER TO LEAVE THAT INDETERMINATE.
>>MHM...

title: Ann Withers Gets Goosebumps - Studio C
